flashcards.back: Bombay Industrial Disputes Act (1938), Bombay Shop Assistants Act (1939), C.P. Maternity Act (1939)
Labour enquiry committees formed by Congress-led provincial governments
N.M. Joshi broke away from the AITUC to set up the All India Trade Union Federation in 1931
In 1935, the communists rejoined the AITUC
The left front now included communists, Congress socialists, and leftist nationalists like Jawahar Lal Nehru and Subhas Chandra Bose
AITUC supported Congress candidates in the 1937 elections
Congress ministries were generally sympathetic to workers' demands, passing favourable labour legislation
Initially, workers opposed the war, but communist support shifted after Russia's involvement
The communists didn't support the Quit India Movement and advocated the policy of industrial peace

flashcards.front: Dock workers of Bombay and Calcutta (1945)?
flashcards.back: In 1945, the dock workers of Bombay and Calcutta refused to load ships taking supplies to the warring troops in Indonesia
Workers went on strikes in support of the Naval Ratings in 1946

mcq.question: Number of unions by 1938?
mcq.explanation: By 1938, there were 296 unions in India.

mcq.question: Labour Enquiry Committee chaired by?
mcq.explanation: Labour Enquiry Committee was chaired by Babu Rajendra Prasad.

mcq.question: Bombay Industrial Disputes Act passed in?
mcq.explanation: Bombay Industrial Disputes Act passed in 1938 under Congress ministries.

mcq.question: N.M. Joshi set up AITUF in?
mcq.explanation: N.M. Joshi broke away from AITUC to set up All India Trade Union Federation in 1931.

mcq.question: Communists rejoined AITUC in?
mcq.explanation: In 1935, the communists rejoined the AITUC.

mcq.question: Left front post-1935 included?
options: Communists, Congress socialists, and leftist nationalists like Nehru and Bose
mcq.explanation: Left front included communists, Congress socialists, and leftist nationalists like Jawahar Lal Nehru and Subhas Chandra Bose.

mcq.question: AITUC in 1937 elections?
mcq.explanation: AITUC supported Congress candidates in the 1937 elections.

mcq.question: Communist support for WWII shifted after?
mcq.explanation: Workers initially opposed the war, but communist support shifted after Russia's involvement.

mcq.question: Communists position on Quit India Movement?
options: Didn't support, advocated policy of industrial peace
mcq.explanation: The communists didn't support the Quit India Movement and advocated the policy of industrial peace.

mcq.question: Dock workers of Bombay and Calcutta (1945) action?
options: Refused to load ships taking supplies to warring troops in Indonesia
mcq.explanation: In 1945, dock workers of Bombay and Calcutta refused to load ships taking supplies to warring troops in Indonesia.

mcq.question: Workers strikes in support of Naval Ratings in?
mcq.explanation: Workers went on strikes in support of the Naval Ratings in 1946.
